results.title: Code blue
results.creator_credit: Andrew O'Sullivan, Pascal Guilloux, Moira Moss and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A busy intersection in a large city. Everyone is going about their own business - waiting to cross the road, minding their children…A jay-walker is run over by a courier van. How fast can the city heal itself? ‘Code blue’ is a tightly directed and beautifully paced film which has screened at over 20 festivals throughout the world. The film’s blue tones help to create a tense and emotive ten minute journey through a fast city.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew O’Sullivan, Pascal Guilloux, Moira Moss and AFTRS

results.title: The Beat manifesto
results.creator_credit: Shilo McClean, Daniel Nettheim and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Hamish lives on a sheep farm in rural New South Wales, but he dreams of reading his poetry in a New York jazz club. After saving all his money for a ticket to ‘The Big Apple’, Hamish travels to Sydney where he meets aging Beat poet Bill Darcy. Bill offers to help Hamish, preparing him for his New York odyssey by teaching him the rules of the Beat lifestyle. Cast includes Steve Vidler as a cop.
Written by Tony McNamara, Daniel Nettheim and Mathew Schulz.

results.title: Little white lies
results.brief_description: Coming out is hard to do - but is procrastinating any easier? Reb finds that when you’ve got a secret and they’ve got your number, a little white lie can sometimes do wonders - but not always. Cast features Joy Smithers and Sylvia Mircevsky.

results.title: The Shot
results.creator_credit: Tim Kreibig, Puven Pather and AFTRS
results.brief_description: After a prolonged career as a war correspondent photographer, Mick thinks he can see through the horror of the environment he works in, until he falls victim to his own convictions! A look into the moral and ethical dilemmas of a war correspondent. Cast features Tony Martin as Mick and mark Lee as Terry.
results.description: After a prolonged career as a war correspondent photographer, Mick thinks he can see through the horror of the environment he works in, until he falls victim to his own convictions! A look into the moral and ethical dilemmas of a war correspondent. Cast features Tony Martin as Mick and mark Lee as Terry.

results.title: Relative strangers
results.brief_description:
Simon thought he knew his parents… A film about a family, a deception and its legacy.
The visual effects in this film were all camera-created, using a technique of projection onto a moving sheet to create the insubstantial and constantly changing images that reflect the perceptions of the narrator (Simon Cooper). Nothing in his world turned out to be what it first seemed.

results.title: The Letter
results.creator_credit: Carolyn Johnson, Anne Delaney and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A visually beautiful film about the pain, fear and courage of the 19th century novelist Fanny Burney, who had her right breast removed without anaesthetic in 1811. It is based on a letter Fanny wrote to her sister some months later. Cast includes Skye Wansey as Fanny Burney and Rachel Blake as the voice of Fanny Burney.
The original letter now resides in the New York Public Library.
